text: I'm sure this is a hot take in most circles, but i'm actually excited for them to get rid of the bike lanes. Maybe there will be less traffic!
I see more and more of those tent cities at places like Trinity Bellwoods, and i think to myself... Maybe i should just call it quits and live in a damn tent. How bad could it be?
I haven't tried Badiali and at this point I'm convinced there's no way its as good as everyone says. Or maybe I'm just coping...
I've asked all my friends, people who have lived in Toronto their whole lives, and none of us have ever been up the CN Tower.

I've had to call the police on my next door neighbors multiple times. They are always fighting and yelling at each other. I think I'm done tho. no more calls from me! we'll let fate decide what happens there...
Pizza Pizza is the best Pizza in the city. Who else is open at 2am when pizza is the most crucial?!

My condo building has a gym, but I’ve never actually worked out there. I just go down in my yoga pants, take a few selfies, and head back up. My partner is convinced I’m getting “super fit” and keeps talking about my “dedication.”

I was late to work because I grabbed a coffee at a trendy cafe on Queen Street. Told my boss I got stuck on the TTC when really I spent 15 minutes trying to get the perfect Instagram shot of my latte art.

When my mom visits from out of town, I bring her to St. Lawrence Market and act like I’m a big “foodie.” In reality, half the time I’m surviving on Uber Eats and frozen pizza, but she thinks I’m basically the next Jamie Oliver.

I keep a non-existent “big project deadline” on my calendar every two weeks so I have an excuse to bail on social plans. Everyone’s convinced I’m working on some top-secret hustle but I don't even work at my dayjob hardly lol
I once lied about being a big Raptors fan to a date because he seemed so passionate about it. Now I watch YouTube highlights frantically before we hang out just to keep up appearances.
I told my landlord I have “severe dust allergies” so I couldn’t possibly take my shoes off indoors for showings. Truth is, I just hate tying my laces again and again.
